name: European Business Initiative on Taxation
memberOrga: The corporate membership representation can be found in the annual work programme: www.ebit-businesstax.com
goal:
EBIT is a cross-industry, pan-European business working group of VPs of Tax and Tax Directors from European-based companies whose aim is to help modernise Europe’s direct tax policy. EBIT aims to help eliminate remaining tax barriers within the single market and offer practical solutions that help businesses operate more efficiently throughout Europe. It does so by engaging in constructive dialogue and cooperation, i.e. ongoing technical dialogue and cooperation with the EU Institutions (Commission, Parliament) and the OECD. EBIT’s technical input to EU, OECD and also national permreps is always rooted in its members’ day-to-day business practice and experience.

PwC acts as EBIT’s secretariat, but it is not a member of EBIT. The secretariat administrates and facilitates the group's practical organization and work, proposes the work agenda, hosts 2 plenary meetings per year and coordinates and submits the Group's collective and consensus-based position papers (nb: not PwC submission), and arranges speakers (key policy officials and policymakers, MEPs) in the EU and the OECD) for the plenary round table meetings.

Fields of interest:

• Aggressive tax planning and BEPS
• Harmful tax competition
• Fight against tax fraud and evasion
• EU Directives, incl. on Tax Rulings,
CCCTB
• EU case law
• OECD Model Tax Convention
• Cooperative Compliance
• Transfer pricing
• Fiscal State Aid
• Corporate tax reporting
• EU FTT
• EU politics and decision-making

EBIT is currently composed of (Sr.)VPs of Tax and European Tax Directors and Heads of Tax of 20 internationally operating businesses.

Re EBIT Position Papers and other EBIT contributions or output: these always contain the collective and consensus views of EBIT and are provided courtesy of EBIT. Nothing in these documents can be construed as an opinion or point of view of any individual member of EBIT or PwC.
